intro: Lacostea auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate lacostea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in subtropical and tropical gardens.
